data.title: Great spot for a coffee break or for lunch!
data.text: Steeltown Coffee and Tea offers a wide range of hot and cold teas, a great variety of hot and cold coffees and yummy sandwiches and pastries.  Many of my friends prefer Steeltown over a well-known coffee spot. Personally, I am a tea drinker. I appreciate that the person behind the counter can explain to me the differences in all the teas being offered and help me make a good choice.  I have never been steered wrong.  I have been here many times for their Afternoon Teas held in the Christmas season. I highly recommend these teas  to anyone who wants to make their holiday season special. The manner of service is impeccable. The tea sandwiches and delicacies and scones are to die for!  The variety of hot teas offered is amazing.  I love trying new ones!  The art on the walls features local artists and is constantly changing. It is worth a visit just to see what is on display. There are games available to play while enjoying a lazy afternoon. I recently spent an evening there playing dominoes. There are hook ups to plug in your computer while enjoying your coffee. The cafe shares space with a local bank branch. Do not be put off by this unique situation.  You do not even notice it once you walk in the door.  There is a parking lot in the rear along with on-street parking.

data.title: At last, a coffee lover's haven.
data.text: At last, a coffee lover's haven.  Here's a place where the owner and staff truly care about coffee.  They are knowledgable, friendly, and very informative.  The atmosphere is surprising... it's located inside a bank and occupies half the facility... so it's unbelievably spacious.  And there's free wifi.  You can't go wrong here.

data.title: Family Owned serving Fourbarrel Coffee
data.text: Contemporary, Italian-style neighborhood espresso bar serving quality espresso, coffee and tea.  They have fresh pastries brought in daily from a local shop.  I love this place!

data.title: Well, it's not really a restaurant... but a fine coffeehouse.
data.text:
Firstly, who has a coffeehouse in a bank! 

I've come to love the idea and many of us Old Town denizens frequent Steeltown for super-perfect lattes, delightful baristas, and great gossip! 

On frosty Winter days Steeltown rolls-out their wildly creamy seasonal hot beverages that toast the cold bones, while baristas warm the heart with their pleasant natures. On warm Spring days we sit outdoors and sip our beverages while watching Old Town pass-by; waving to neighbors and wishing good-days to those that catch our eye.  Summers are cool indoors and there is always a bit of gossip in the air. As a foil to the soaring temperatures you'll find a constellation of cool coffee drinks, as well as flavored iced beverages. Fall is the perfect time of year to visit Steeltown Coffee & Tea. Firstly, October is their anniversary and there is always a great party that owner, and bon vivant, Adrien Badger hosts. Secondly, the scent of warm pastries, toast & jams, and warm pumpkin lattes fill the air with reminiscences of visits to grand-mother's cozy home, where red and orange leaves float onto the lawn as grand-father mutters how it's time to rake the yard.

Steeltown is not your average coffeehouse... it's an experience. I hope to see you there someday!!

data.title: Awesome place for a relaxing cup with a friend
data.text: This is one of my favorite places to go for a coffee meeting with a friend or my hubby. The coffee drinks are all awesome, and the chai tea is creamy and delicious. I highly recommend this for a 'slow down and enjoy the roses' kind of day!
